column5: Not nearly as good as original Toasty Tech Tights
column6: The pair of Toasty Techs I have from 3 years ago are excellent cold weather tights. The original Toasty Techs are made out of super stretchy, butter soft fabric and the fit is snug, but not too tight so as to be too constrictive (not good in cold weather). The Toasty Tech II on the other hand is made out of a fabric that is far less stretchy and not nearly as soft. Also the fit and construction are very sub-par. The overall fit is too tight (I'm 5'2", 110) - my usual size 2 is difficult to get on, partially because the seams are bulky and WAY too tight. Please bring back the original Toasty Techs!

column6: These tights run large in the waist but fitted in the legs. I went up a size from my normal tights since in my experience fleece lined things aren't as 'stretchy'. I run year round in Michigan so when the air temps are in the single digits and teens, I do find that I have to layer with a pair of pace rival crops under these to be really warm. But, I love the huge side waist pockets that have no zippers! It can fit my iPhone 6 no prob and then I don't have to fumble with any zippers with my gloves on. I don't know that I would have paid full price for these, though, since when it is really cold I still have to add a layer.

column6: I wanted some cold weather times for early morning runs and these are perfect. I have to take an extra minute putting them on because the zipper pocket doesn't stretch, but once they're on it's not a problem. And my phone doesn't fit with the pocket zipped, but I've gone on two long runs and left the zipper open with my phone inside and it's tucked in plenty deep so it doesn't move. True to size, warm and comfortable.

I bought a pair of these as a Christmas present to myself since I needed some cold weather running tights. The second time I put them on, some of the quilted stitching ripped. I know that these are the correct size and they did not rip because they don't fit or something (I had ordered an 8 and had to exchange for a 6). Thinking that perhaps the ripping was user error, I sighed and continued to wear them. But the next time I put them on, the stitching came undone even more!! It's like one of those slip-knot style stitches that unravels in the blink of an eye as soon as there's an opportunity.
You can see that the quilted pattern is coming completely undone, and these will look like a puffy saddle bag on each side of your thigh. I've only washed them once by now, but it's clear they are NOT going to last, and what's worse is that by the time they unravel completely, they'll be extremely unflattering with unnecessary padding in the outer thigh area. So disappointing.
A secondary disappointment was the useless size of the pockets. Can't fit a phone or much of anything aside from a card or gel. I'm so mad I bought these at full price as my present to myself. That said, I don't think I would even recommend them at WMTM prices because of the inevitable stitching issue that will render them unflattering in the future.

column6: I was very excited to try these babies out, but I'm worried they will bust at the seams. The fabric is very soft but it doesn't have much give and the stitch pattern on the outside of my thighs are so tight I feel like I am going to pop the stitching loose. These are also not made for girls who have a muscular booty. I am super sad that these were unable to work for me. Planning of giving away to a friend who will take them off my hands.

For reference, I am 5'7 and weigh 135 and wear a size 6.
Usually I have to layer my tights in the cold weather, but these keep you amazingly warm even though I have horrible blood circulation. I have read many of the reviews on here and I don't seem to be having much of he same issue. The pockets are a little small and I wouldn't recommend trying to fit your phone in, although mine fits in snugly (iphone xr).
I think that the design is very flattering and adorable.
There is cross stitching on the tights and you do need to be a little careful with it as to make sure that you don't tear the thread. As long as you get a size that fits and you don't rush to pull them on, they will last fine.

column5: Still in Love with the Toasty Tech Tights
column6:
I have the original toasty tech tights from several years back. They've held up great, aside from minor pilling where the toggle on my running jacket rubs.
After seeing them on WMTM I knew it was time to snag another pair... same colour black... same tts 6... for reference I'm 5'6" 130lbs.
They do not disappoint! I love the length as I have long legs and want all of my legs/ankles covered in the cold. The high rise keeps you warm. I never use the pockets but I like how they look, the extra quilting is warm and the reflective details are a bonus. The stitching has never popped but I grip them from the front and back of my thighs to avoid that. I wear them running and nordic skiing and find they don't stretch out so I can use them more than once before laundering. Tech fleece is thicker and warmer than just brushed luon. Still, if it is colder than -10C and there is significant wind chill, I wear wind pants over top to keep warm.
Honestly, I don't feel much difference btw the new and old ones I own except my old ones are well-loved and broken in. At $89 on WMTM I think these are a steal!

My friend bought these for me as a gift and I have been sadly disappointed. Nowhere near as warm as my older lined lululemon tights, however, the stitching in the quilted portion is VERY fine and VERY unstable. I don't wear these to workout - just to my desk job and after the first wash (on handwash in my front load washer), the stitching has come loose.

I normally love Lululemon leggings. I find they are superior to most brands and last longer. Unfortunately, the best way for me to describe the Toasty Tech Tight II is trash.
The fabric is thin and the fleece is barely there. This is NOT a legging that will keep you warm running in the winter. I’m 5’4 and 125lbs with an athletic body type and have never had a problem before with size 4. That wasn’t the case with these leggings. First of all, the Toasty Tech Tight II was designed with someone who is 5’10 in mind. You can’t even short and wear them without having them hemmed. The leggings were a good three inches too long and hard to put on.
The quilt design below the zipper is also low quality besides the fabric itself. As I tried the leggings on the stitching popped. This is something I would expect after wearing the legging 100 times, not the first time.
Altogether I feel that the quality for this leggings is what you’d expect in a $20 pair of leggings, not a $138 pair. I would strongly advise anyone looking to purchase these leggings to buy a different style or look elsewhere for fleece leggings.
I would like to point out It’s potential I received a faulty pair. However, judging from other reviews, this is just a badly designed pair of Lululemon leggings.
I hope this was informative for anyone looking to purchase these leggings! Good luck!

I brought these to a tailor but she said that quilting will always fall apart if it's on stretch material and declined to fix the problem. I bought these pants trusting lulu's quality and design without trying them on first. I am 5'7, 150lbs - fit TTS (6). I was very disappointed as I was rushing to meet a run buddy and wearing these for the first time that not only are the pockets too shallow for a phone (small or plus sized phone) but there is also no zippered pocket (or any pocket) on the back for keys. The cross stitching on the legs (which looks cute) is not functional as the thread used is too rigid (not stretchy) - if you pull these up in a hurry you'll rip the stitching (I did). I went into my local store to see what could be done and was told if they were not 'performing well' for me that I could do an exchange. When I brought in the pants to exchange them and spoke to a different employee I was told that ill sized pockets or missing pockets do not affect performance - I disagree! If all I wanted was a simple pair of leggings I definitely would not be shopping at lulu. Disappointed lululemon.... I don't think anyone wants to carry their items in their hands while running (especially not for $150!)

These do pill easily which is mildly disappointing for the price but I'll take some minor thigh pilling over literally freezing my butt off. What is also great is that the fabric also manages to keep wind out, keeps sweat/moisture off of my body, and the high waist helps keep my core warm. I took a chance on these since the educators at my local store were not familiar with winter running, and it was worth it. These are a cold weather must have. column6: As an avid runner who takes great pride in running, I wouldn't trust anything else but lululemon's running pants. I run great long distances, and these tights never left me down once. I wouldn't rely on the pockets to store my iPhone 6 because it gives it a weird shape. I might have an issue come Spring time when I ditch my running jacket. It is not of enough an excuse not to buy them. Deeper pockets would have been awesome! I AM TOTALLY IN LOVE. Going back soon to buy the black ones! Legs looks amazing too, nice and toned.

I bought these and a pair of brushed Inspires because I wanted to pick the warmer pair. Loved them as soon as I put them on and immediately took the tags off. Wore them for a run and then sat on my microfiber couch for a few hours. Literally only wore them for 3 hours and the bum of these pants looks like they have been worn hundreds of times. Its so horrible looking that I wont be wearing them out again. This all happened a few months ago but I havent taken them into my local store because every time I have gone in with a legitimate issue, they treat me like Im trying to scam the company. I took it into the store and they were awesome and switched my pair for a new one. Then it happened again! I think it is rubbing against my jacket, which is why it is pilling. If I am paying this much for it, It should not be pilling after one use. Now i have to be careful with what I wear with these pants which is annoying. Its not worth the investment to have to think about which jackets are going to make the fabric pill. I definitely would not recommend this.

Anything lower though, might not be warm enough for Alaska life. However, I wore them at 5K race last weekend and spent the entire thing pulling them up because they kept sliding down! I should have run in them beforehand but man I was bummed. I'll just keep them for walks from now on.

These pants will definitely keep you warm while running outdoors but Im extremely disappointed to say that after 2 washes they seem to be faded and the stitches on the seams seems to be fuzzy. Definitely would not expect that kind of wear after only 2 washes.

column6: I am a seasoned runner who was in long overdue need of a pair of warm running pants and these are them. I'm so grateful to be able to run in cold temperatures and actually not have my legs get cold. It's a total game changer. I'm 5'7 and 148 pounds and normally wear a 6 but got a 4 in these and am glad I did. They fit perfectly and wash well too. I religiously only hang dry these to ensure they last years (and winters) to come.

I was starting to dread my outdoor runs and decided I needed to gear up. These are amazing! I'm not fazed by pre-sunrise, sub twenty-degree weather and have no excuses not to run outside (save rain and snow). I'm 5'5 and 132 lbs. Usually wear a size 6 in Lululemon bottoms but went with a 4 for these per a sales associate's recommendation and am really glad I did. After a few wears, they really have started to mold into my body shape and fit like a glove. They're so comfy and want to wear them even when I'm not running. Probably will be the case in the fall when they're too warm to run in.

I am a true to size 4 (except the align pant, I sized down in those) and I got a 4 in these because typically their running tights are well, tight. Especially being brushed, I had no worries. I have now worn these 3 times and I'm constantly pulling them up. I tied the drawstring waist band as tight as i could but it doesn't stop that its loose around the actual waist and when I run they kinda sags. I tried the 4 on in stores first and they felt fine so I had no idea they wouldn't fit and didn't even try a 2. But if I bought another pair I'd probably have to go with the 2 as the falling down is uber annoying. They are so warm though and I get cold so easy so I wear them for not just runs.

Thank you LULU for pants I can run in winter!!!! I live in Wyoming and run outside year round. It was 20 degrees on my first run with these and I stayed toasty!! I'll also be wearing these under my ski pants. The fit is hugged, which I love. I'm 5'9 160lbs muscular build. Size 8 is perfect.
I received these pants as a gift and fell in love the first time I tried them on. They were my usual size but they ran a little tight.

Let me just start by saying this is the 32nd pair of Lululemon pants and so depressed. Again I have purchased 32 pairs and I am a 6! I ordered these from a store out of town because mine nearby did not get these because they are Cold Weather Gear and San Diego didn't get any. As soon as I pulled them out of the FedEx bag and felt them I thought LOVE then I put them on and what a let down!! Right in time for Valentines Day...Perfect! The waist seems true to size but right out of the package the legs are too big, lots of extra material in the legs especially behind the knees and I have muscular legs I'm not a tall lengthy type. More short and muscular with bigger legs and gluts. Soo soft and very nice fabric but very awkward fit. Hoping I can try a size down but they aren't available online and I will have to call around back East to hopefully find a smaller size but not sure that that will even work since like I said they don't seem a size bigger everywhere. the waist doesn't seem big but the legs new with tags. I can only imagine how bad they would stretch out if I ran in them a few times. SO SO SAD LULU!! Very nice fabric but not true to size!!! So DEPRESSING they aren't true to size especially for the price as they were not on sale!

With the second pair I noticed some lose threads but decided to leave it cause I didn't want to be picky, but with only washing them twice and hanging them they started to pill A LOT in random spots, so I took that pair back and got another, again the staff was very understanding, I wore the 3rd pair once, and have been taking really good care of them and then I looked and they are pilling again, I don't know what to do or why they are doing that.

column6:
I don't know what to say. The pants fit snugly two days ago in the store. The sales person said that I had a good fit. I wore them around my house twice. My other high-waist Lulu pants stay up nicely because the waist band did not stretch out.
I fully understand that stretchy fabric will likely relax in a year or two, but not in less than a week. I should have clued in when I tried on two pairs of the same size and found one more snug (which I purchased). I thought I was being smart as some reviewers had mentioned inconsistencies and you just need to find a "good" pair, check the seams, etc. I have bought lulu for eleven years, with great results, so I am feeling upset about these. Worse yet, they were marked down in store and my receipt says final sale. I have tried to convince myself they may still be wearable, as I did like them, but having to yank them up repeatedly isn't cool. Issues of functionality aside, they are also not flattering when they sag.
I wonder if it is the Lycra in the band that is allowing it to loosen? Luon seemed just fine in the other pants.

I purchased them for figure skating and I was never cold on the rink once, I know go to school up north where its common to be -20 and these are my go to, never cold. ONLY complaint is the reflectors ripped a bit, after washing the leggings and them stretching, the reflector detached from the seem a bit but is still in tact and didn't create an actual rip in the leggings.

i love these pants. they are so warm and perfect for any outside activity. i wear a 4 in these my normal size. 5'4 and 118 lbs. they are high waisted but super comfortable and flattering. i wish they made more colors!

Bought these pants after struggling through last year's winter weather and these guys keep me plenty warm. Ended up using them as a base layer for skiing in December and they worked great! Enjoy wearing them with oversized sweaters/shirts when going out (they keep you warmer than leggings, but look the same). Love the side pockets and that they have a higher waist. Have held up fine with multiple washes in the washing machine. Fit TTS.

column5: Streches out after a few hours loungin around.
column6:
I own easily 100 pairs of Lulu pants and crops and never have had such a bad experience with these. I was excited to get some warm running pants to run outside. Put these on with the intention of going for a run. Unfortunately it rained so I stayed home and lounged around the house. A few hours after wearing these doing basically no activity, I found myself pulling these up constantly, and noticed that the area around my knees all the way down to my ankles were no longer tight and the fabric was loose.
These are my TTS and fit pretty snug when I put them on. It's pretty disappointing that I paid $130 for these and didn't even do any physical activities before they got completely stretched out.

Out of all of my lululemon leggings these ones are my favourite. They are very warm and comfortable to wear at any time of the day. Whenever I travel, these are my go to leggings.

column6: I had high hopes for these tights. They're soft and feel great going on but ... they slide down :( I had to stop repeatedly on my first run in them to hike them back up. If you do order these, order down, they seem to run big.

These are my favourite pair of lulu lemon tights. I love the material and the fact that it is waterproof makes these tights so practical. The tights fit true to size, i am a 4 in all lulu lemon pants and these were no different. I love how the pockets have zippers so that nothing falls out. The pockets are a little bit small, not big enough for my iPhone, but nonetheless i still love these tights. They're ideal for winter because they are warm, however, they can be worn in all seasons. So many of my friends want a pair of these tights, bring them back in the black please!!!!

I run trails outside all year round, and am always looking for tights and pants to help keep me warm. While I love the fleece lined feel of these tights, and the warmth that they provide, I find that the zippers on the side pockets decrease the amount to stretch and mobility that the pants actually have. I find they fit well when I am out for a walk, but when I start to run, the pants actually start to get pulled down from the zippers. I am constantly tugging them up, even with the elastic pulled tight. It's not that the waist is dipping to low, but rather the saggy crotch is driving me bonkers.

I purchased these tights just before Christmas and I have been living in them! They are quite toasty and have been keeping me dry and warm during my winter runs. The detail on the tights are nice! I bought a size 6 but wish I would have tried on a size 4 as they seem to fall down during my runs. As a result, I am adjusting the tights and notice while doing so, I pulled some of the stitching so now I have several loose strings. If you purchase these, be careful of this. Other than that I love them and wear them all the time!

I absolutely love these tights. They're so light weight (perfect for running) yet keep you warm -- and i've used them while running cold Oregon winter nights.. they were perfect!

When I tried the 8 in store they were a little too tight, the 10s suited me much better. After a wash they go right back in shape, however. Overall, not bad. column5: if you can get a good pair..
column6:
After reading about these tights for a while and needing a good, warm pair of winter running tights, I sized down to a 4 based on the other reviews warning against stretching out. At first when I pulled them on, I was afraid I'd made a mistake because they were TIGHT (I have decently muscular legs from weight lifting and running) but sure enough, they stretched a bit to allow a more comfortable fit. I wore these tights twice before washing, only on errands and lying around the house, and after the first wash on a delicate cycle, inside out, cold water, hung to dry, I noticed the stitching on one of the outer seams began to unravel. I contacted Lululemon and after sending some pictures and answering some questions, I ended up returning these for store credit. I was very hesitant to re-order, but I loved the plush feel and snuggly fit of the Toasty Tech's, so I ordered another pair.
So far, fingers crossed, I have not had any unraveling, and I've probably washed them 5 times now. I recommend sizing down due to the stretching out of the material after time, but I've never had an issue with them being too baggy. These tights kept me warm on an early AM run in 25 degree weather, and I love the snug high-rise fit. They are also a great length, they are long enough to cover my ankles without a bunch of extra material bunching at the bottom. I never experienced any pilling with either pair.
Buying these is kind of a gamble on whether or not you get a good pair it seems, but Lululemon gives such great customer support and these tights are so dreamy, it was worth it to take the chance. For reference, I'm 5'6" 122lbs 32B-26-36, and sized down to a size 4 in these.

I bought these running pants since I didn't have any tech fleece tights, so I thought they would be very useful for our cold midwest winters. I finally took the tags off last week to wear the pants while I shoveled the driveway (since temps are now at 0 degrees F). When I was done I was going to immediately text my friends to buy these pants -- they were sooo comfortable and warm! However, as I took the pants off I noticed that the seams around the crotch were UNRAVELING!! Lulu, I love your clothes, but the quality of these is terrible. This is the most I've ever spent on pants (more than I spend on jeans or dress pants), and after the FIRST wear I can no longer wear them, unless I spend more money to get them fixed! And once I get them fixed by my seamstress (who is across town and by appointment only - difficult to get in), how do I know the seams wont start unraveling in another area on the pants? As I said before, I have crops/pants from 2012 that I've worn a ton of times, and they have just now started showing wear along the seams. I can't tell you how disappointing this is. We are now in the coldest month of the year with temps regularly below 0, and I can't wear these.
I bought the dark grape color. From reading other reviews, it sounds like this color had issues with the seams. They haven't been washed yet, and I think I would be afraid to, until the seams are fixed.

column6: I ordered these TTS and they feel AMAZING. The fit is great, and I love the quilted detailing on the sides. They don't feel like they would be super warm for running, but I've read reviews that say they are so I'd be willing to try them. They don't feel compressive though, and do fee like they might not keep their shape (as some reviews have stated). Ultimately I decided not to keep these since I already have 2 pair of insulated CWX compression tights for winter running, and I was too scared to take the tags off these and risk not loving them.

I have bought a lot of lulu products and didn't even really hesitate to purchase these tights, with a steep price tag. I have never had any issues with lulu products until now. They are very warm and fit well. I have only had them for approximately two months and have only worn them a hand full of times. I always wash them on gentle, and never put them in the dryer. The stitching is unraveling. Very disappointing for the price and the little bit that I have worn them.

column5: Nice and warm, but bag out
column6: I bought 2 pairs in my usual size 6. Love the look and feel of them, very cozy. But after just wearing them for a day running errands, they are loose and I'm constantly pulling them up. Quite baggy in the knees and bum. A total disappointment and expected a lot more at this price point.
These feel amazing and look phenomenal on. Warm and cozy but functional and stylish. I love the detailing and the color. These can also be worn with boots in a winter casual setting.

column5: So warm, but material is lacking
column6:
Preface: I LOVE THESE PANTS. They are warm, flattering, and the bordeaux color is stunning. I've had these for a month, and they have loosened a bit, but are still incredible on.
However, the pair I ordered, had to be exchanged after three wears because all that beautiful stitching on the thighs unraveled, and several seams had loose threads sticking out all over the place. This was after two wears and no washing.
The replacement pair, same color and size, they've held together at the seams (thankfully, as I've had this problem with lulu pants before). The inner thighs of this pair are SO badly pilled, I can actually see the fleece coming out, they feel rough to the touch. I'm afraid to wear them anywhere, lest the pilling completely destroy the upper half of these pants.

column5: Keeps you warm but gets loose after 2 wash...
column6:
These pants do a good job on keeping you warm. The wind still can get through a bit but it's not a major problem. Overall they do match what they are claimed to be, toasty.
However, I do find that after a few wears, the pants get saggy at the knee area. After 2 washes, the waist and hip just get so loose that I have to keep pulling the pants up.
I am usually a 6 or 8. I tried the 8 on and they fit really well when I first put them on. I didn't wear them doing extreme exercise. I wear them for commute and once I get to work I change to my work clothes.
I didn't choose a overly small size for my body but I don't know how this can happen just within a few wears and 2 washes.
It is frustrating to see that the quality doesn't meet the price. After all I paid almost $140 after tax for these pants.
I do rate them for the warmth but not really impressed with the quality...
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Alexray,\nThanks for reaching out to us about your Toasty Tech Tight II. I’m sorry to hear of the material stretching that you’re experiencing with them. We stand behind the quality of our gear, and we’d like to work with you towards a solve. I’ve sent you an email to follow up and help. Chat with you soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 8, 2015'}

column6:
I was feeling really cold that my Rulu wasn't helping me with, so I went to Lulu to get some warm clothes. I ended up with a pair of these in Grape. I knew they would fit the bill when I got too warm in the dressing room!
The zipper on the pocket is beefy and doesn't feel like it will break, the pockets are big enough that my huge phone fits most of the way into it. I'm not sure I'd run with my phone in the pockets, they aren't secure enough for that, but I'd use them for ID or extra cash or tissues.
They are thick and warm and soft. I wore them under my lined dance studio pants to go to the mountains where it was below freezing and windy, and I didn't notice my legs getting even slightly chilled!
Overall, I'd rate them 5 stars if they had better pockets. I've worn them about 4-5 times already and washed them once and haven't had any pilling problems. I think if I see the black with a solid waistband in the store, I'd have to debate a second pair! I like to be warm!

column5: They Definitely Keep Me Toasty but Slide Off...
column6:
I am a Lulu addict. I absolutely love their products and how they fit and feel. I purchase items from Lulu several times a month and VERY rarely do I ever have any issues which is incredible, especially due to the sheer volume.
I bought these pants a month ago and absolutely loved them. They are incredibly warm which is great when it is 29-30 degrees outside and you want to go on a brisk walk or jog. I was debating between a 4 & 6. The staff assured me that the drawstring in the waist kept them up so I went with the size 6.
Now it has been a month, I wear them once or twice a week and they are really loose. I don't normally have this issue but because of the material they are now saggy and Unflattering. They also keep slipping which sucks if you are doing anything active. My sister had a pair on today in a size 4 and hers looked great. Fitted as they are supposed to. Mine are definitely loose and baggy which is such a bummer. I wish I had sized down to a size 4.
I am not recommending that everyone that normally wears a 6 size down on these pants but for me, I'm always in between a 4 & 6 and wish I would have gone with the 4 so that they still fit me.
Lesson learned.

column6: I initially loved these when I tried them on in store. But I just ran in them for 1 hour. I was wearing all lulu including a jacket and when I got home one whole leg was pilled terribly from I don't know what?!? There was nothing sharp or with a lot of zippers. I'm so disappointed that I spent $120 on junky pants. Ive never bought anything from lulu that pilled so badly. Extremely disappointed.

column6: For reference I am a high school student, 5'4" 125 lbs and am I size 6 in all my bottoms and these are no different. Living in Iowa I needed a really warm pair of pants and these are perfect. I wear them at least twice a week and for weeks and haven't experienced pilling as other reviews have said. These are very nice pants for the price and I have recommended them to all of my friends!

I bought those for winter running and wore them several times already. They are really nice and comfortable! I do not think they will keep me warm at -20, but till -10 I can definitely wear them outside with the winter running shorts on top.
I had to go one size up because of the zippers in the upper leg.
I bought these today to hike in and promptly hiked Mt. Sanitas in them on a 50 degree day. They were perfect…not too hot and just right. Now how will they work in cold temps…we shall see !

I've purchased three running tights from lulu over the last two years and a handful of speed shorts - although the price of the toasty techs made me nervous, I don't regret it one bit, and in fact they are my favorite lulu piece!
The sizing is perfect (which is a relief, as lulu's sizing is kinda all over the place) and the tights stayed in place on a good run without needing adjusting. The fabric feels AMAZING. Some may consider this fabric good only for the coldest runs, but I'm pretty cold natured and can comfortably wear these in the 30's/40's Fahrenheit.
Seaming and fit is very flattering - if these tights came in a mid- to light-weight fabric, I would buy more! The black grape I managed to snag is just the kind of non-black neutral I've been looking for.
Really the only con I can think of is the price, but I'm still not sorry!

i bought these a month ago and they are absolutely amazing!! so warm and i can definitely see myself running in these throughout winter. just wondering if you guys will restock these in black? i would love to buy more of these for winter running as i only have this 1 pair. i also love the inseam length because i am petite. thanks so much lululemon!!!

I was looking for a pair of tech fleece tights to replace my well-loved ones from 2009, and I think I have found them :) Abosolutely love the black grape colour! Such a nice change from basic black. I bought my tts 6 and while they are not as compressive as some of my other running tights, I find them extremely comfortable, while still giving some support. I think a size down on me would show major pulling around the side-thigh zipper pockets and along some of the leg seams. i'm also curious to see if they will stretch or bag out with wear in my tts pair--hope not :) They are super cozy and warm, but the wind does go through them unfortunately. I use these for running, cold weather hiking and think they will be great for x-country skiing and snowshoeing too. Great as a layer under shell pants. No pilling issues so far. Fabric is opaque with a matte finish, no apparent shine, like the black ones I've seen. The zipper pockets are lovely, keeping keys and other little items secure. As for length, I'm 5'5" and found they hit at the ankle. I always wear wool crew socks under my tights for running in cold weather, so i'm covered even if the tights are a little shorter. High waistband is perfect for cold weather, and nicely holds the tummy in. Overall very pleased with these so far. Plan to put them to the test all winter :) One star off for the price.

I bought these pants for trekking in Iceland and for running through the Fall. It took me a few weeks to mull over the purchase but I finally bought them. While the pants are warm and flattering, within two days of wearing them the side quilted panel started to pill. It's really too bad because otherwise they are great pants and I would probably buy another pair if they didn't pill. I don't think I will be recommending them.

column5: Love these - but not holding up
column6:

I thought that would be foolproof but apparently not. I love these so I wish I knew how to keep them looking good!
Size reference - I am 5'3 110lbs and I fit size 4

column6:
I don't know what kind of black magic goes into making these tights, but I'll take it. They simultaneously insulate (great for cold weather runs) and ventilate (great for after those first couple of miles warm you up), and they're very compressive yet comfortable! I feel like Hermes every time I run in these. The reflective material is also quite useful for people like me who prefer running in the wee hours of the morning or way after sunset.
My only complaint is that I'm not able to get these hemmed. I don't like when my pants bunch up at the bottom, so I have to fold them up. Heads up, fellow petite women!
Measurements for reference: 5'3 135 lbs., size 4

The fit feels great. I like how they aren't so tight in the crotch.. say no to camels.
Also, the material is another great thing. Nice and stretchy but doesn't overstretch to the point of becoming baggy.
The length is perfect, no complaints. I have long legs, i'm 5'8 and most of the time wear boots anyways so wouldn't notice the difference.
The side pockets are a fab idea and they are indeed warm.
Oh.. and I love the color :) -- I will be buying my mom her 2nd pair for Christmas as well, that's how much we love them!

Today it was -11 C with the wind chill and I was fine in these pants for a 5k run. The high rise is great.
Pockets are plentiful but the horizontal orientation of the zipped pockets makes for an awkwardly bulging phone. You can keep the phone in the waist pocket but not too comfy. anyway, it works and it's fine while running.
The pants could be 1" longer: I'm 5'7" 138 lb and don't have extraordinarily long legs. I got my normal size 6. Above an ankle sock, there was just a sliver of skin showing. For winter, I would take the inch of extra length to avoid ankle exposure.
I would have bought a 2nd pair but not sure with the inch of fabric missing!
another thing that occurred to me while running was that the quilted part is a nice extra layer; if it extended across the whole front of the thigh it would make the pants work in colder temps without really making them too hot for 0 - -5 runs

I bought these tights when I realized I had signed up for a 5k that was going to be in the thirties, and I really love the fit and zippered pockets. The tights are plush, and were actually almost too warm.
However, looking at race photos afterwards, I was somewhat appalled to see they were crazy shiny! I'm a little hesitant to wear them again after seeing that picture, even though they were fantastic on a functional level. I've been fluctuating between a size four and six in Lulu bottoms, and went with the four because I'm tired of yanking my pants up continually over the course of a run. I don't know if the shiny-ness is because I sized down (because the pants are not sheer and fit well in the waist) or if it's just the fabric in general. But it's just not a good look.

I'm always looking for a warm pair of tights for winter running in Winnipeg and these are awesome. Granted it hasn't dipped to far below zero yet, but these keep me toasty. I'm 5'6" and about 150lbs. I ordered a size 10 and they fit perfect, they are a little longer on me but I'm ok with that. I haven't had an problems with pilling like other customer have and I've worn them a number of times running (I've had them for about a month).

column5: Warm but not the best quality...
column6:
I loved this pants when I first saw them in the store and of course (as most Lulu pants, they fit PERFECTLY!). They definitely live up to their "toasty" name, they are lined with warm fabric and keep you nice and warm when running outside.
Unfortunately, I was disappointed with the fabric on the outside of the pants. After only a couple times of wearing them they started to fray and part of the pants looked as if they had rubbed against velcro which was a bit odd considering none of my jackets have velcro.
I love Lulu pants but ultimately, I wouldn't recommend these, but they are very warm!

column6: These are an awesome running tight for cooler autumn and early winter running, but they are nowhere near thick and fleecy enough for the winter I know is coming... But so perfect for that 0deg celcius weather. I'd like to see more reflectivity and they could be longer (on my 5'9" frame they are above ankle) but overall a really great tight. The side zips make them stylish enough for a lifestyle tight too - I picked up my kids from school today and ran to costco and they were perfect on a chilly day!

I bought 3 pairs and I love them. I love how warm they are. Haven't tried them in the snow yet, but I think they are going to perform. I also love the zipped pocket to tuck in my house key, etc. well done Lululemon!

So I got the Toasty Tech Tight II because I was looking for something that'd keep me warm when I run in the winter and as I walked around campus during the colder months. The pants are so comfortable and so form fitting, I got so many compliments from my friends. Not only was I able to wear it for workouts but also to go out too! I wore them twice and here comes the bad news. The seams started to come undone in certain place and it really disappointed me given the price I paid for these pants! Super sad about this cause I actually LOVE them and i'm always careful with keeping sharp objects away from these pants.
I'm 5'3" and these fit perfectly above my ankle and the high-waist is perfect for me. Love the pockets as well but i'm careful with what I put in them cause I don't want to stretch them too much.

column5: Just a smidge longer would be perfect
column6:
I bought these in my TTS 8 for Lulu bottoms. I am 5'7ish and 142 lbs. I have disproportionately long legs for my height and worried based upon the reviews that they'd be too short. They expose maybe 1/2 inch of skin between the tops of my no-show socks and the bottom of the tights so it's not as bad as I expected. However, a little bit extra length would have been appreciated.
I do like the styling details of these tights, particularly the quilted panel on the side of the thighs. While my iPhone 6 in it's Speck candy shell case does fit in the side zip pocket, it sticks out in a pretty obvious way because it has to be oriented horizontally. I prefer the vertical pocket of the Speed Tights and Rebel Runner crops. But if it's cold enough that I'm running and wearing these tights I'd be wearing a jacket or vest with a pocket and can certainly put my phone in that so this isn't that big of a deal to me.
I haven't run outside in these yet, but they are definitely a cozy option for just casual wear and I do expect to wear them quite a bit. They made their debut this morning for a trip to the grocery store :).
column15: just a smidge shorter than i'd like

column6: I wish I would have tried these before now! Such great pants. Soft and warm on the inside and smooth and matte on the outside. I LOVE the black grape colour. It is such a nice shade. Everything about these pants is spot on. My TTS 6 fit perfectly. I am 5'6" and they slightly go past my ankles. I love the pockets and the quilted pattern on the side of the leg and the logo on the calf! I will definitely purchase another pair in either black or another colour if it is released. The price is higher but I feel these are well worth it.

I wanted to love these pants they were my 20th pair of lululemon pants, literally. But seriously 1 day after i used them. They started to pill. I'm a small girl size 4 so that was frustrating. For the price I was really dissapointed and i am stuck with them because I used them. So really consider it before you spend the money on something you can only wear 1 time.

column6:
I bought these recently and have been, overall, very pleased with them. When I take my pup out for early morning walks (quite chilly, I live in Colorado), my legs stay pretty warm. I'm not saying they're completely toasty, but they're a big step up from my regular wunderunder tights.
The only real drawback that I've experienced is that they're not windproof at all. So with the slightest breeze, you're legs get way colder and you wish you had different pants on. If you live in a windy place, I'd find something else, unfortunately.
I haven't experienced any pilling yet, but my use has been pretty minimal.
For me, the fit is good (5'6", 130, size 6), but they do seem a little looser around the knees than usual. I'm wondering if a size 4 would have been better.
Lulu - PLEASE make a windproof tight!

I ordered these in a 6, expecting them to fit and perform like my original release Toasty Tech tights (I'm 5'7", 130 pounds). They really don't. The leg is much shorter (exposing my ankles), compression is weak and they won't stay up. I ran 5K in -10 this morning, the entire front of my things and my buns were bright red and stinging (and this is with no wind). The saggy crotch really bothers me - very unflattering and just disappointing all around.
I'd pick up another pair of the original release in a heartbeat - but these are awful, especially for the huge leap in price.

column5: will keep you warm but PILL
column6: I love these tights because they keep me warm.. I wore them on a run in Jackson Hole and I was snug the entire time. I was disappointed that when I came back, they had little bumps on the front of my thighs. These tights are warm but NOT worth the money.

column6: It was perfectly warm for a short run and the bordeaux is beautiful for just walking out and about. The length is fine on me at 5'6". I find these are not as stretchy as the normal speed tights, probably because they're thicker, but they're TTS. Haven't had any pilling, and so far I'm happy with my splurge purchase.

column5: My new favorite leggings for cold weather!
column6:
I got these leggings as a gift in the bordeaux color and I love them! I've gotten so many compliments. I especially love the copper zippers on the side pockets, which is also great for people like me who are constantly paranoid about things slipping out of pockets so the zipper reassures me my items are secure. There are also 2 pockets at the waistband, so plenty of room to store your phone or anything else. These pants have definitely kept me warm in the cold weather. I'm 5'3, 135lbs with fairly muscular legs and a 6 fits great.
Highly recommended! Although, I admit if I was buying them for myself I'd be a bit turned off by the price tag.

I have owned these pants for exactly one week and I've worn it about 5 times (shows you how much I like these pants). I love everything about these pants EXCEPT it's durability.
The pros:
Super soft, warm, AND breathable! They are great for just walking around in cold weather but do not get too warm during runs/bike rides. Its currently around 50F around where I live.
Super flattering
I love the pockets. Great for phones, keys, etc.
The length is perfect for me (I'm 5'5" 115lbs and I bought the 2). I can understand that if you are taller, these pants may be a tad short.
The cons:
They pill! I've biked in them a couple of times (very short bike rides, 20min roundtrip max) and there is significant pilling around the butt. Lululemon says that pilling doesn't affect the durability of these pants but I feel like the material is thinner around the butt b/c of the pilling. If I sized up, the waist band would be falling down so I do not believe that the pilling is due to a sizing issue. I don't know if taking these pants back will help since a lot of ppl seem have problems with pilling.
Lululemon, please make the material more durable! They need to be stand up to what they were designed for and right now they do not.

column6: I am in LOVE with these. I wear them to work, class, and walking to the gym. I'm not much for running outside (or in general) since I live in a city, but they keep me warm on my walks to class (so the lack of reflective material doesn't effect me as much!). They even look cute with the pockets unzipped! My only problem is that they pilled near the thighs which is normal for heavy wear. None of my other lululemon pants have pilled like these, but I do wear these pants quite frequently!

column5: Love My Toasty Tech Tight II
column6: I just received my tight from Fed Ex. Fits really great, I'm 5' 2.5" and 110 lbs, Size 8 fits me just right and just a little long!:) I can't wait to try it out for a run !:)

Love, love, love these. They fit tts. Super warm and love all the pockets. I am 5'8 and the length was fine, my ankles were covered. I have yet to run in them so haven't experienced and pilling like some reviewers.
column14: the high rise and all the pockets

column6:
I just got these pants and don't want to take them off they are so comfortable. I ran a half marathon in them yesterday and they were great (it rained for the whole race). I am 5'8 and the length is great. I usually wear a size 10 in Lululemon and the size is perfect and they fit my big thighs.
That being said, here are my concerns- for winter running and less light, I wish there was more reflective material on them. Also, after the race yesterday, I noticed some pretty major pilling on the thighs and in the front where my running jacket meets my pants. I have only worn them twice, but during the winter in Wisconsin, I have to wear a jacket. I still think they are worth it, but will have to wear with longer tops to cover that.

We have sent you an email outlining your return options.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 1, 2015'}

column6:
So these fit tts and I got my usual size 8 and cover my ankles perfectly but then I am only 5'4" I guess the length is an issue for taller ladies.
They are very toasty like the name suggests and are great on those cold runs. I like the side pockets but would have liked the back pocket to be there too.
My real only issue is I don't like the high rise waist. I would have preferred a mid-rise one. Also my other complaint is the continuous drawstring. I hate that feature because it seems like you can never get them tight enough with that drawstring.
Also going to side with another reviewer, these need reflective detailing. Winter runs are often done in the dark for lots of people.

I'm so, so happy I made this purchase for fall-to-winter running. The fabric is dreamy—perfectly soft on the inside with technical weatherproofing on the outside. I expected the toasty techs to fit TTS since they have the extra layer, but I actually had to size down to get a good hugged fit. (I usually take a 4, but went to the 2 for comfort—no regrets after several runs!)
Because these are designed for cold weather running, my only complaint would be an absence of any reflective material on the bottoms themselves. As a whole I find Lulu lacking in that department, actually. Please make more items with reflective strips for nighttime/early morning runners! That's especially important for the winter gear, which is often used during shorter days. For now, I've added some reflective bands to the toasty techs for safety.

These pants are amazing, and well worth the price. I wore them this morning on a run in 25 F temps and my legs were not even remotely cold. They fit like a glove, are super comfy, and have great pockets. The reason I took off one star is due to one small thing that I think does impact the performance of these pants (I wish there was the ability to do 1/2 stars, because I would have rather just taken off a 1/2 star because they are so great otherwise). These run tights are for COLD weather, but are not even ankle length....that does not make sense to me! I have about 2-3 inches of bare skin sticking out above my socks. That was the only part on my body that was cold on my run today. These fit TTS, I am 5'8" 133 lbs and my usual size 6 are perfect.

Probably one of my favourite purchases in the Lu Lu pant department yet. I find these to be flattering, warm and super soft. I went in for the black pair only and came out with the burgundy too. Can't wait to wear when temperatures drop.

These tights are a dream. The main reason I purchased these pants is because the zippered rose gold side pockets are both practical and brilliant. And my butt looks amazing in them (which is not always the case with Lulu attire)! The high waist complimented the full length and they did not droop in the nethers. I found with my old Speed Tights I was cursed with a drooping crotch due to filling my pockets with keys, cards and a phone when I went adventuring. Not the case with these pants. They are a 'thermal fleece' which sounds frighteningly warm, but they keep me covered and warm but not overly insulated. IMHO the price point's a bit high but I trust that they will do the job better than a <$100 pair could. Slow clap for you Lulu, these pants rock!

Now THIS is how you do pockets! When I run I carry a lot of stuff with me and haven't been able to run in my favorite LLL because a lack of usable pockets. These pants have fixed that problem! Two large zipper pockets on the legs are big enough for my iPhone 6, ID, keys, and $. The waistband pockets are large enough to hold my GUs and keep them easily accessible. Please roll out these type of waistband pockets across the board and especially to shorts!!
The fit is comfortable, snug, and very flattering. Love them!!

column5: The best running warm pants EVER!
column6:
I seriously love these pants so much! I run at 5am in the mornings and I needed a warm pant for the upcoming fall/winter Canadian cold weather and these pants are unreal!
They absolutely stay in place, I didn't have to pull them up or touch them once for my 4.5 km brisk run. They aren't too thick to make you feel like you are carrying extra weight, they feel almost just as light as my other lulu running pants for spring/summer, but with the cozy warm brushed material inside to keep my perfectly protected. The high waist is extremely comfortable, the most comfortable waist yet for running pants. I feel the detail stitching helps keep the pants in place on every curve of your body and make you look extremely flattering. They are TTS, my normal pant size is 6 and they fit amazingly.
I have to admit that I was planning on returning them when they arrived because of the price and thought perhaps I bought them on impulse because they were something new on the site. After a few days of contemplation I decided to keep them and finally try them. I'm so happy I kept them and these are seriously my go to cold weather pants. If you're on the fence about these, buy them, they are an absolute necessity if you run in colder weather =)

Yes, thicker and great for warmth during early rainy mornings and late evening runs..
great leggings.
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

column6: ENOUGH SAID! These pants keep the chill out of my body like no other! I can stop with breaks from running here and there and not have to worry about any chill setting in. These are amazing!!!!!!!!

Ugh these are PERFECT cold weather pants.... If you are under 5'5". If you are 5'6" and over... good luck! ALL of the new running tights are now made super short. Lulu please make pants that will cover my ankles!! Even bring back last years length of 30".. this 28" nonsense means I will have to look to other brands.
Fit review: I am 5'6" 122 lbs tts 4 and the 4 fit perfectly(ignoring the short length)
These are the best yet, I have the last two years of fleece bottoms and these are by far better. High quality and extremely soft and the rose gold zipper on the Bordeaux make this perfect.

column5: Totally PERFECT! Totally TOASTY w/o being Roasty!!
column6:
Amazing tights! No less.
Fit TTS, Im 5'4.5" and 112 lbs and a size 4 fits me just fine.
Very snug feeling, without being overtly warm. I just biked from my home to university this morning and it was chilly! How'd I know? Through parts of my skin that were uncovered, but with these tights? I did not feel a pinch of cold, NONE!
I wore my innerwear under a Superb long sleeve, a Kanto Catch Me 1/2 Zip from this year and these Toasty Tights, and I was still a bit sweaty when I reached campus. #I was not zipping fast through the route, no! Just cruising!#
The side pockets with reflective zippers are great, they donnot dig into your skin at all, plus the pockets on sides of waistband are awesome for slipping some gel packs or plastic money when out for a run or gentle walk with your dog or friends.
If you are torn between Speed Tight *Brushed and these Toasty Tech Tights, I would say get the Toasty Techs. I have the Speed Tight *Brushed too... and when the chill sets in, which it has started to in the Northern hemisphere... STBs won't stand a chance, but these Toasties will keep you Toasty without being roasty and help you stay ready for the ride!
Thank you Lulu design team for another winning product!!!
PS. Make the waistband a medium rise maybe, next time?? Thanks!!

I'm really excited about these pants. I've been looking for a tight that would be warm enough for the Chicago winters and I think this is it. I was a bit hesitant with the "fleece" in the fabric description because I thought it would be the type that would allow air to flow through or would hold moisture, but these are definitely more of a tech fabric designed for running in the winter (I probably wouldn't wear these for any indoor athletic activities). They have a quilted pattern along the outside of the thigh that I didn't notice in the pictures, but I really like it. The thicker fabric is also pretty flattering - it definitely has a smoothing effect! I thought they ran true to size and they are a full-length pant as opposed to the 7/8 pants that have been around lately (again, good for winter running!).
I bought the black and bordeaux drama. The bordeaux ended up looking a little shinier in person so I will be returning those and keeping the black. Maybe I will buy them if they end up in the WMTM section.

I just received these today and I can't wait until it's cold enough to to wear them. They are incredibly soft and cozy and I know I will get a lot of wear from these! I bought the Bordeau Drama colour and would buy a second pair if they weren't so expensive! They go perfect with my new Fleecy Keen Jacket in the Wine Berry colour because they both have Rose Gold zippers and diamond shaped quilting. These pants have four good sized pockets and a lot of nice details. I have very long legs with a 32" inseam and they are more than long enough for me. Ordered my usual size for tights and they are perfect. Love EVERYTHING about them but the high price, as usual.
